about.description:
Cylc ("silk") orchestrates complex distributed suites of interdependent
cycling (or non-cycling) tasks. It was originally designed to automate
environmental forecasting systems at NIWA, however Cylc is a general
workflow engine; it is not specialized to forecasting in any way.
about.summary: A workflow engine for cycling systems

name: cylc-flow
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "cylc-flow" %}
{% set version = "8.0a1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: "{{ version }}"

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 36f4f4363cb5cc7a3a613d2db6e84cc41c2825c6cd011191cc4821c5ca9c81a4

build:
  number: 1
  skip: True  # [py<37 or not linux]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python
  run:
    - ansimarkup >=1.0.0
    - colorama >=0.4
    - cryptography
    - graphene ==2.1.6
    - jinja2 >=2.10.1
    - markupsafe >=1.1
    - metomi-isodatetime >=1!2.0.1
    - protobuf >=3.7
    - pyasn1
    - python
    - python-jose >=3.0
    - pyzmq >=18.0

test:
  imports:
    - cylc.flow
  commands:
    - cylc --version

about:
  home: https://cylc.github.io/
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'A workflow engine for cycling systems'
  description: |
    Cylc ("silk") orchestrates complex distributed suites of interdependent
    cycling (or non-cycling) tasks. It was originally designed to automate
    environmental forecasting systems at NIWA, however Cylc is a general
    workflow engine; it is not specialized to forecasting in any way.
  doc_url: https://cylc.github.io/documentation.html
  dev_url: https://github.com/cylc/cylc-flow

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - hjoliver
    - kinow
    - oliver-sanders
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.15
